content: betty k s chevron stripe hat by betty kiesewetter the greater st louis knitters guild this is a basic hat pattern with a chevron design materials us 8 5mm 16 circular needle us 8 5mm double-pointed needles worsted weight yarn 3 oz of main color mc about 25 yards of 1st contrast color cc1 about 25 yards of 2nd contrast color cc2 it is important to place a marker at the end of your round all colors are slipped as if to purl with yarn in back cast on 84 stitches join in the round note you can increase or decrease the hat s size by adding or deleting stitches in multiples of 4 with main color work 6 rounds of k2 x p2 ribbing then knit one round change to cc 1 with cc1 work round 1 *k1 slip 3 repeat from * round 2 k2 slip 1 *k3 slip 1 repeat from * ending k1 rounds 3 & 4 knit work rounds 1 - 4 with cc2 work rounds 1 - 4 with mc repeat all three colors two more times then continue in mc knitting each round until the hat measures 5 5 decrease for crown round 1 *k10 k2tog repeat from * rounds 2 4 6 8 10 knit round 3 *k9 k2tog repeat from * round 5 *k8 k2tog repeat from * you ll probably want to change to double-pointed needles here round 7 *k7 k2tog repeat from * round 9 *k6 k2tog repeat from * round 11 *k5 k2tog repeat from * round 12 *k4 k2tog repeat from * round 13 *k3 k2tog repeat from * round 14 *k2 k2tog repeat from * round 15 *k1 k2tog repeat from * cut yarn leaving long enough tail to run through remaining stitches secure
